channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: Logging has been temporarily halted in 26 unburnt areas of Victorian forest amid concerns about “serious and irreversible damage” to threatened species after summer's bushfires.
item.title: Court halts logging in unburnt Victorian native forest

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: A survey of more than 1400 sports fans has found less than two fifths are in favour of a return to play for the country's five major leagues.
item.title: 'It's become too corporate': Research shows Aussies split on sport return

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: National death toll hits 90; Yarraville childcare centre closes; Sunshine hospital workers sent home

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The Learning Sanctuary in Yarraville will not re-open until at least Friday after the children, from the same family, were tested for the virus.
item.title: Childcare centre shuts as two children await results of virus tests

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVID-19 cases in the US surpass 1 million, University of Queensland vaccine shows promise as Australian death toll stands at 90

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: national death toll rises and more 50,000 vehicles intercepted on the Gold Coast at the border

item.description: This compact and moving film follows Fiona O'Loughlin's travails after leaving rehab.
item.title: What's on TV: Monday, May 4

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: Looking near and far, there are many reasons for the AFL to proceed with even greater caution towards a restart. Even the fans think so.
item.title: Fans maintain social distance from AFL

item.description: A shrewd piece of placement from trainer John O’Shea will give smart sprinter Southern Lad he chance to enhance his already impressive record in the Wagga Town Plate on Thursday.
item.title: O'Shea eyes another payday with Southern Lad in Wagga Town Plate

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on an eight-race card at Wagga.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Wagga on Thursday

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The government payments aim to protect the state's $12.6 billion international education sector from global competitors after the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: Victoria offers $1100 relief grants to struggling foreign students

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: The Newmarch House aged care facility in Sydney's west has become the most notorious hotspot for the deadly disease after the outbreak aboard the Ruby Princess cruise ship.
item.title: 'Mental anguish' for residents of COVID-19 cluster nursing home as families request chance to wave

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: Investigations underway into allegations milk products from dairy giant Saputo have been transported by an unlicensed contractor
item.title: Food safety regulator probes claims of unclean milk tankers

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Court is sitting from 2pm to accommodate the state's final fibres witness, Dr Ray Palmer, who will give evidence via video link from the UK due to coronavirus travel restrictions.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: 'I was thinking about jumping out the moving car': Claremont party-goer tells of close call

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The online payments giant has told a senate committee it has been forced to ramp up tracking off fake virus remedies on the web.
item.title: PayPal fights fake COVID-19 'immunity tablets'

item.description: How have money, geography and culture contributed to the divergence in Australia's two leading winter sports during this pandemic?
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus special

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: For 59 years, Guinness flowed at the Celtic Club's city home. But the ale won't run again, after the club pulled the pin on returning to the redeveloped pub.
item.title: Celtic Club, $7 million poorer, won't reopen at city home of six decades

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Trevor Watts claims he was "catching up with neighbours in our respective driveways on Sunday afternoon", but police allege it was a more serious breach of COVID-19 rules.
item.title: MP told others to stay home days before he was fined at 'street party'

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Captain Cook was a great mariner but this is of little importance in a post-Imperial Australia.
item.title: Indigenous voice must speak loud in Captain Cook commemorations

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Queensland says a Commonwealth move to bring forward funding for private schools that reopen is "depserate" amid a tug of war over getting students back in classes.
item.title: Queensland slams 'desperate' federal move to fund schools that reopen

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Brisbane's new $3.6 billion Queen's Wharf casino and resort complex will have 800 more gaming machines - a total of 2500 - under its deal with the Queensland government.
item.title: Queen's Wharf will have more gaming machines than Treasury Casino

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The former sports minister has denied using taxpayer funds to favour marginal seats in a new response to a scathing audit of a $100m sports funding program.
item.title: Bridget McKenzie denies 'special treatment' in $100m sports affair

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: People working across Western Australia’s battered hospitality and tourism industries will be required to undertake a specialised COVID-19 hygiene course before reopening.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Extra hurdle before re-opening cafes, restaurants

item.description: Lawyers for victims of the 2011 Brisbane floods and a large Queensland dam operator agree about how to split one of Australia's biggest class-action payouts.
item.title: Victims and dam operator in 'furious agreement' over Qld flood payout

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Australian Health Minister Greg Hunt was blindsided by mining billionaire Andrew Forrest's decision to invite a top Chinese diplomat to speak at their press conference.
item.title: Chinese consul-general crashes Hunt’s press conference

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: The Australian Banking Association has been searching for a new public affairs boss for months. Now the recruitment process is over.
item.title: Turnbull lieutenant Sally Cray heads to banking lobby

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: COVID-19 is causing blood clots and strokes in some patients. Doctors are racing to work out why.
item.title: Opera singer among those hit by COVID-19 blood clot mystery

item.description: Thanks, MasterChef, for a refreshing and modern update.
item.title: Green Guide letters: TV viewers have their say

item.dc:creator: Ben Pobjie
item.description: Tom Gleisner and Urzila Carlson on the vital role of Have You Been Paying Attention? and why no one wants to be Sam Pang.
item.title: Why HYBPA? is bringing back familiar faces - even if some are in masks

item.dc:creator: Craig Mathieson
item.description: "It just leapt off the page for me. The writing was so nuanced and subtle," lauded TV director Kate Dennis recalls of the genre-bending, playful script of the new series Run.
item.title: 'Seductive tonal mix': Handmaid's Tale director relishes new series Run

item.dc:creator: Larissa Dubecki
item.description: Connolly's genial personality shines through in this journey into America's Scottish history.
item.title: Billy Connolly's latest travelogue reveals he has plenty of life left

item.dc:creator: Peter Wells
item.description: Normalising the taboo topic of failure can be especially constructive during the challenges of COVID-19, says podcaster and scriptwriter Michael Kahan.
item.title: A comedian finds success in documenting his peers' failures

item.dc:creator: Ben Schneiders
item.description: Analysis shows Australia has not been as generous as some other countries in supporting international students through the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Australia gets poor score on international students

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The Prime Minister says the government is committed to a suppression strategy for Australia's recovery from COVID-19.
item.title: Morrison wants restaurant openings and domestic travel under eased restrictions

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: Some NRL stars would have had to renegotiate their club contracts if the season extended into November.
item.title: Why an October 25 grand final saves NRL another massive headache

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: Not only are the code's players regularly forced into close contact with each other, they also have a history of struggling to follow guidelines.
item.title: Is there an industry more at risk of spreading COVID-19 than the NRL?

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: The NRL is adamant it will return to games as soon as possible, but the AFL is remaining cautious. So, why the vastly different approaches?
item.title: AFL and NRL: why the differences in return to play?

item.description: Staging the Tokyo Olympics next year isn't contingent on the discovery of coronavirus vaccine, senior International Olympic Committee (IOC) member John Coates says.
item.title: Tokyo Games in 2021 not reliant on vaccine: Coates

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Senator Jacqui Lambie wants Medicare rebates for counselling services and a crack down on multinational tax before looking at industrial relations changes.
item.title: Tax multinationals and fix mental health before union laws: Lambie

item.description: Two men who used a stolen Porsche to ram police vehicles in a Melbourne shopping centre car park after a crime spree have been jailed.
item.title: 'Go! Go! Go!': Jail for hoons who stole Porsche, rammed cops at Northland

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: Group executive editor James Chessell joins national editor Tory Maguire to discuss why COVID-19 has inflamed the already complicated relationship between Australia's sporting codes and their broadcasters.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: when will sport come back?

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: Tiger Woods played there in December, now Melbourne's most exclusive golf club is delivering food and wine to members who are paying thousands to not hit a ball.
item.title: 'Up to Dan': Premier the bogey man as top club goes from tee to dinner

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.description: The Tour de France may have to limit spectators during the first days of the race in order to comply with a ban on major events gathering more than 5000 people before September.
item.title: Tour de France may have to severely limit fans for start of race

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: Vietnam's response to the coronavirus crisis has been overlooked, but the communist south-east Asian nation has been a rare success story.
item.title: Vietnam has reported no new coronavirus cases for 12 days. Why?

item.description: Maev O’Meara was a pioneering female journalist at a time when many women stayed home and didn’t pursue careers.
item.title: 'Isn't that marvellous': lifestyle journalist lived in the moment

item.dc:creator: Adam Turner
item.description: Why spend thousands to get the latest streaming apps and technology when the best media players are around $250?
item.title: How to keep your TV but upgrade the smarts

item.description: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences has changed the eligibility rules for this year's Oscars to allow films to be considered without a theatrical release.
item.title: Pandemic forces change to Oscars rules

item.dc:creator: Benjamen Judd
item.description: We've rounded up 18 thoughtful Mother's Day presents — from sustainable sneakers to a glorious new scent — in lieu of the brunch outing she deserves.
item.title: The best gifts to treat your self-isolating mum

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Two dozen staff at Sunshine Hospital in Melbourne's west sent home to isolate after a patient who underwent surgery later tested positive to COVID-19.
item.title: Staff at Sunshine Hospital sent home after patient's positive test
